plugins.name: LayeReName
plugins.description:
LayeReName is a Figma plugin designed to simplify and streamline the process of renaming layers and text content within your Figma projects. This simple yet powerful tool offers five renaming options:

  • Title Case: Capitalizes the first letter of each word, except for pre-defined excluded words (articles, prepositions, conjunctions).
  • All Caps: Converts all characters to uppercase.
  • Lower Case: Converts all characters to lowercase.
  • Title Case All: Capitalizes the first letter of every word, without any exceptions.
  1. Capitalize: Capitalizes the first letter of each sentence, detecting sentence endings based on punctuation marks such as '.', '!', '?' and ':'.

With LayeReName, you can also choose to rename the content of text layers by toggling the "Rename content of Text Layer" option. This feature allows you to maintain control over capitalization and naming conventions across your entire project.
plugins.tagline: LayeReName: Streamline layer & text renaming in Figma for consistent, efficient designs.

With LayeReName, you can also choose to rename the content of text layers by toggling the "Rename content of Text Layer" option. This feature allows you to maintain control over capitalization and naming conventions across your entire project.

plugins.name: BM i18n
plugins.description:
A powerful tool designed to streamline internationalization (i18n) workflows. With a range of features, it simplifies the management of multilingual content, enables efficient text editing, and facilitates seamless exporting of i18n resources.


a. i18n item management

  1. Create and edit i18n items effortlessly, incorporating i18n common features like plurals, variables, and formatting.
  2. Collaborate seamlessly by sharing and updating i18n items between Figma files, as if you were working with Figma components.


b. Text content editing

  1. Assign i18n keys to Figma text layers with ease. Choose to search manually or let the plugin automate the assignment process.
  2. Effortlessly edit variables, apply plurals, and format your Figma text layers, adding a touch of flair and perfection to your translations.
  3. Seamlessly switch between different languages within your designs. Explore and evaluate how your interface looks and feels in various languages, ensuring a delightful user experience for all.


c. Exporting made simple

  1. Generate JSON Language files effortlessly, fully supporting the i18next JSON format v4 and the i18n-js format. Copy and integrate the exported code into your development workflow effortlessly, saving you valuable time and effort.
  2. Overcome Figma's viewer plugin limitations with ease. Annotate keys of texts directly on the canvas, providing developers with intuitive reference points, eliminating the need for searching or memorization.
plugins.tagline: A powerful tool designed to streamline internationalization (i18n) workflows.

plugins.name: Upbuilder.ai | Figma to Webflow, Elementor, Bricks, HTML/CSS
plugins.description:
UpBuilder (Beta)


UpBuilder is an AI-powered Figma plugin that converts your designs into clean code - simple as that. Currently free while in beta!


No need for auto layout - the AI creates the flex and grid layout for you.


What it does

- Turns your Figma designs into real, working code

- Supports Webflow, HTML/CSS.

- Elementor, Bricks and more platforms coming very soon


How to use it

1. Select your design frame

2. Click export

3. Wait a few seconds while it processes and extracts the data

4. You'll be redirected to the project page while the code processes

5. Choose your preferred platform to export (Webflow, HTML/CSS, etc.)

6. Done!


Note: Processing time depends on your design size - bigger designs might take a more time to process.


For more info, visit: https://upbuilder.ai/
plugins.tagline: Free AI Figma to Code Converter - Export to Webflow, Elementor, Bricks, and More

plugins.name: Empty States: Perfect SVG Illustrations
plugins.description:
Empty States: Perfect SVG Illustrations


Empty States is your go-to Figma plugin for effortlessly finding and integrating free, beautifully crafted empty state illustrations in SVG format. Whether you're designing for onboarding, no-content pages, or error states, this plugin provides high-quality visuals at your fingertips, helping you communicate ideas and elevate your UI design.


Say goodbye to blank screens and hello to meaningful placeholders. With EmptyStates, adding personality to your product has never been easier.


👉 How to use EmptyStates:


  1. Open the plugin in Figma.
  2. Search for your desired empty state illustration.
  3. Insert the SVG directly into your design.
  4. Voilà! You've filled the void with style.

accepted.name: Superfiles
accepted.description: Built with love by Team Superfiles – 6 years of design magic, now packed into a plugin bundle that makes your Figma flow super. Welcome to effortless design.

plugins.tagline: Illustrations for Every Empty Moment - Add Empty States illustration in one click

plugins.name: sizessimo-converter
plugins.description:
Generate variables via sizessimo.jamillazarev.com


Dependency: variables plugin


Usage

  • Generate variables using https://sizessimo.jamillazarev.com/
  • Click "For Figma" in the upper right corner
  • Run the plugin, Paste & press "Run"
  • Install & run variables plugin


Keep in mind

  • A short link, properties & CSS will be attached to the hidden layer.
  • The plugin knows what you have already generated – you don't need to reconnect the variables if you don't change names. Just paste the new URL into the plugin and press “update variables” in variables plugin

accepted.name: Jamil Lazarev
accepted.description:
Dad, husband, manager, designer, mentor and sometimes developer.
9 pet-projects with 30k+ users: Figma, Amazon, TripAdvisor, SimilarWeb, Harvard University, etc

plugins.tagline: Generate variables via sizessimo.jamillazarev.com

plugins.name: Tailwind Sync
plugins.description:
Tailwind Sync is a tool box that bridges Figma variables and Tailwind code, streamlining the collaboration between designers and developers, from simple projects to design systems.


Features

  1. Plug and play: Simply drag and drop the file into your code editor and start coding with the exact same theme as in Figma.
  2. Variables, not values: Tailwind Sync outputs variables instead of hardcoded values, perfect for complex, scalable design systems in enterprise environments.
  3. Built-in changelog: Automatically tracks and documents changes to variables and text styles, ensuring easy versioning and clear communication with a shared language across design & development teams
  4. Tailwind scoping: Ensures Tailwind scoping matches Figma’s, guiding developers to use values consistently, and maintain design integrity.


Tips for Using the Plugin

  1. Ignore Design-Only Folders: If your variable path includes design-specific organizational folders, place them between parenthesis (e.g., (folder)). The plugin will ignore these.
  2. Text Styles Exclusion: Aside from font-families, the plugin does not take text style-attached variables into account.
  3. Scope Tailwind Variables: You can use Figma’s scoping feature to limit your Tailwind variables to specific properties.
  4. Changelog Tokens: The tokens displayed in the changelog represent the final class that the developer will use (e.g., bg-button-primary).


For a Deeper Understanding

Check out our walkthrough videos to get started with Tailwind Sync

  1. Overview: https://x.com/source_paris/status/1836378230321779145
  2. First-time setup: https://x.com/source_paris/status/1837019103233520044
  3. Tailwind scoping: https://x.com/source_paris/status/1838262832451981433


Enjoying this plugin?

  1. Share it with your team and network
  2. Upvote on ProductHunt
  3. Drop a comment, we’d love to hear from you!
  4. Check out our other plugin, IconDescription


About

Tailwind Sync is built by source.paris

We craft useful, durable and beautiful digital products.

Follow us on Twitter and LinkedIn

accepted.name: Olivier Chatel
accepted.description:
UX Designer | Managing director source.paris
Bureau of Design & Technology

plugins.tagline: Variables to Tailwind in one click

plugins.name: Flash Setup PRO
plugins.description:
🌟 Welcome to the Figma Page Organizer Plugin! 🌟

This plugin lets you swiftly create, organize, and remove pages, keeping your workspace neat and tidy! 🚀


🌈 How to Use Flash Setup PRO:

Add Page Names:

  • Type the name of the new page into the text field.
  • Click the Insert button to add the name to the list. 📝
  • To add a divider, click the Add Row button. It will be added to the list as "---------------------------------". 🌿
  • Remember, page names and dividers can be reordered by dragging them in the list! 🔄


Generate Pages:

  • After adding all desired names, click the Generate Pages button to create the pages in Figma. 🎉
  • If a page named "Page 1" exists, it will be renamed to the first name on your list! 🥇
  • Dividers are added as pages but can be added multiple times without name changes. 🌟

Remove Pages:

  • Click the Remove Pages button to delete all pages from the list, except the first one, which will be renamed to "Page 1". 🗑️
  • This step will reset your Figma file to the default state with a single page named "Page 1". 🔄


🌟 Quick Tips:

  • 🚫 Avoid Duplicates: The plugin won't allow you to add duplicate page names, so no worries!
  • 🔄 Reorder with Ease: You can reorder page names and dividers in the list simply by dragging them.
  • 🌿 Flexible Dividers: Use dividers to visually organize your pages. They can be added multiple times!


🎉 All set! Now you know how to use the Figma Page Organizer Plugin! Enjoy organizing your pages! 🎉
plugins.tagline: Flash Setup PRO Organize, Craft, and Transform: Figma Pages in a Click!

plugins.name: Tab Text Override
plugins.description:
Tab through every text override in your selection. Stop mousing around!


How to use: 


  • Select any text element, symbol(s), etc. 
  • Hit Cmd + T
  • Start typing to override first text element within selection.
  • Tab to select the next text element to override, or Shift + Tab to go to previous text element.
  • Enter to save and close.
  • Esc to revert last edited text element and close.


To add a line break, hit Option + Enter.


To buy me a coffee, venmo @dbilyk :)


Hope someone can find this useful!


Note: This plugin currently only works on text elements that have exactly ONE font for all characters in the text element.

accepted.name: Dmitri Bilyk
accepted.description: CXO at an early-stage stealth startup. Building tools for the future of the creator economy.

plugins.name: Export to Threads
plugins.description:
Tired of hacking together multiple tools to share your work and get feedback on it? Now you can export Figma frames to Threads to share designs with your team, gather feedback in one place, and present your work.


How it works

  1. Download the Mac desktop app and sign into Threads
  2. Go to your organization on the top left of Threads
  3. Use the drop-down and select Integrations
  4. Under Personal Apps find Figma and press Sign in
  5. Follow the set up instructions
  6. Once you're set up, select Figma frames you want to get feedback on, or present, and press cmd+; to run the plugin and send the frames to the Threads desktop app
  7. Add context to the frames, tag your teammates, or add video narration to walk through them


You can also interact with a Figma prototype directly in Threads by copying it and pasting it into a thread.


What is Threads

Threads is a Slack replacement designed for makers. To get early access to Threads, you can sign up here: https://threads.com/


Help articles

  1. How do I install the plugin?
  2. How do I import frames?

40903.name: Export to Threads
40903.description:
Tired of hacking together multiple tools to share your work and get feedback on it? Now you can export Figma frames to Threads to share designs with your team, gather feedback in one place, and present your work.


How it works

  1. Download the Mac desktop app and sign into Threads
  2. Go to your organization on the top left of Threads
  3. Use the drop-down and select Integrations
  4. Under Personal Apps find Figma and press Sign in
  5. Follow the set up instructions
  6. Once you're set up, select Figma frames you want to get feedback on, or present, and press cmd+; to run the plugin and send the frames to the Threads desktop app
  7. Add context to the frames, tag your teammates, or add video narration to walk through them


You can also interact with a Figma prototype directly in Threads by copying it and pasting it into a thread.


What is Threads

Threads is a Slack replacement designed for makers. To get early access to Threads, you can sign up here: https://threads.com/


Help articles

  1. How do I install the plugin?
  2. How do I import frames?

plugins.name: Style Merger
plugins.description:
Style Merger allows you apply multiple text styles to a text layer automatically based on language character sets.


Supported character sets:

  • English
  • Korean (Hangul/Hanja)
  • Japanese(Hiragana/Katakana/Kanji)
  • Chinese (Hanzi)
  • Emoji


How to use:

  • Create a local text style for each language
  • Toggle languages and set the style to apply for each language
  • Press the 'Apply styles' button while a text layer is selected to apply all text styles


Save presets:

  • Toggle and select styles on the "Styles" tab
  • From the "Settings" tab input the name of your preset and save it via the "+" button.


Load presets:

  • From the "Settings" tab press the load button to load styles from a previously saved preset.


Coming Soon

  • More language character set options
  • Support for remote library text styles
plugins.tagline: Multi-language text styles

plugins.name: URL2Design
plugins.description:
Ever wanted to quickly import an existing website's design into Figma? We felt the same, that's why we made URL2Design. Now, you can easily pull websites into Figma and start tweaking it, jumpstarting the creative process. 


URL2Design, your shortcut from the web straight into Figma elements. ✨


Here’s how it works:


  1. Spot & Copy: Find a website that sparks inspiration for you or your client.
  2. Paste & Generate: Paste the link into URL2Design Figma Plugin
  3. Tweak: Instantly get the Figma elements, ready for you to tweak it.


Why URL2Design?


⌛Time-Saver: What used to take hours of designing from scratch, now takes less than 10 minutes.

🧪Freedom to Experiment: Start with a solid base and let your creativity flow, tweaking as you see fit (or your client’s fit)

⚡Efficiency Boost: Spend less time recreating and more time refining and innovating.


We hope this tool brings you closer to your efficient design workflow. Happy designing! 

Curious about the tech? It’s made with love by Symph.
plugins.tagline: URL2Design

plugins.name: Dynamic Type Preview
plugins.description:
Select an object, choose the dynamic type sizes to check, and push the button. Boom, you now have a way to see how your mockups will look like at different Dynamic Type sizes.


Font size and line height of selected text should match one of Large Dynamic Type's font styles.


A font style with the word 'fixed' in its name will be ignored by the plugin.

plugins.name: DSync
plugins.description:
This plugin helps the designers and developers to automate the process of syncing Figma design system changes straight to the codebase design system.


It is quite useful for the designers to make changes in the design system without notifying developers about each change. Adding 10 new icons in Figma can now be easily transformed to the code as files with one click instead of exporting them manually by the developer. Changing the accent color will not only take effect everywhere it's used in Figma components, but also in the code components just as fast.


At the moment, the plugin works with such design tokens as

  • icons — it searches for "COMPONENT" types on a Figma page and returns them in .svg format only
  • colors — it searches for "PAINT" types on a Figma page and returns them in .json format
  • typography — it searches for "TEST" types on a Figma page and returns them in .json format


For instance, if we run the plugin on the page with icons and send the changes, the PR will be creates with all the new .svg files, which are not in the base branch yet.


Plugin form has several fields which are necessary to be provided:

  • repo name — the name of your Github repository with the code design system
  • your Github token — here are the instructions of how to create it)
  • owner name — your Github nickname if you own the repo or the name of the company
  • head branch — the name of the branch where you make the changes to your design system
  • base branch — the name of the base branch where you are to pull your changes


By pushing the "Sync" button it pushes all found token styles to the head branch of the provided repo and creates a pull request to the main branch.


📩 Do not hesitate to suggest any additional functionality if you think the plugin might be helpful to you!

plugins.name: AI Image Maker (free)
plugins.description:
AI Image Maker is a Figma plugin that lets you instantly create up to 4 AI image generated images or graphics right from within Figma. No need to log into another service, add an API key, or anything else.


This is great for people who want to add some context to their designs before they share it with a client.


👋🏻 First things first:

  1. 100% free: no payment or fees required
  2. All AI images created can be used for personal and commercial projects


🥧 Incredibly easy to use:

  1. Super simple: just open up the plugin, enter your prompt, and click the "Create" button
  2. Choose to either create 1 or 4 images at once
  3. Browse through your previously created AI images to quickly insert one you made in an earlier design session


🤔 More:

  1. All AI images are added as the top most layer so you can easily find it
  2. All AI images are named with "🪄 AI Image Maker" at the beginning so they can easily be found / searched for


🛟 Feedback:

  1. We'd love any ideas or questions you have: feedback@berryplugins.com
  2. Leave a comment if you want to tell people how great this plugin is


🎉🎉🎉
plugins.tagline: Create AI images in 10 seconds for your designs.

plugins.name: CSV to ChArt
plugins.description:
CSV to ChArt – Convert CSV Data into Beautiful Auto Layout Bar Charts in Figma

CSV to ChArt is a powerful and easy-to-use Figma plugin that turns your raw CSV data into stunning bar charts—automatically formatted using Figma's Auto Layout. Whether you're a designer, data analyst, or product manager, this plugin lets you visualize tabular data in seconds—directly inside your Figma designs.


Key Features:

CSV to Chart Conversion – Paste your comma- or tab-separated values and instantly generate clean, scalable bar charts.


Auto Layout Ready – Charts are built using Figma’s Auto Layout for maximum flexibility and easy editing.


Design Friendly – Customizable bars and labels to match your project’s style.


Fast Prototyping – Save hours on manually building charts from tables.


Works with city data, survey results, analytics exports, and more.


Who is this for?

Perfect for designers, UX researchers, product teams, and anyone who presents data in Figma—without switching between tools like Excel or Google Sheets.
plugins.tagline: CSV → Chart with Auto Layout

plugins.name: BestPrice.gr
plugins.description:
This plugin will populate the selected layers with product-related data (title, price and image), based on your query.

How it works:

Select layers (text or rects).

- All text layers containing $ or € will be filled with product prices.
All text layers named "descr" or "description" will be populated with product descriptions, if available.
- All text layers that are not handled as "price layers" will be filled with product tiles.
- Rects wil be filled with product covers.

Notes:
1. Too small layers are ignored.
2. Locked layers are ignored.
3. Rects without (visible) fills are ignored.

accepted.name: BestPrice
accepted.description: The human-centric ecosystem connnecting consumers, retailers and brands.

Figma Design to React Code Automation


Generate React code from your Figma design Preview your app immediately in browser Download generated code for FREE


Material UI components supported


Feel free to use and customize MUI components directly in your Figma design. They will automatically be translated into React MUI components accordingly.


Easy to understand guidelines

Clean, pixel-perfect front-end code


Output ready for the development. Presentation code is separated from your business logic. Use Reactor anytime when design is updated.


Explanatory documentation

plugins.name: Select Siblings in Auto-Layout
plugins.description:
A plugin that quickly selects elements inside auto-layout frames. It allows to pick just one element and then expand the selection in numerous ways. Can be useful when dealing with long lists of layers, such as news feeds, chat interfaces and many more.


Supports the commands listed below:


Select to the Beginning

Selects all the elements located before a selected one (i. e., those positioned above or to the left of the element in an auto-layout frame).


Select to the End

Similarly, expands a selection so as it will include the elements located after a selected one (positioned below or to the right of the element).


Select Between Elements

Selects all elements located between the two nodes that have been already selected.


Expand a Selection Backward

Adds the previous element to a selection.


Expand a Selection Forward

Similarly, adds the next one.


Select the First

Basically, selects the first element in a list.


Select the Last

Does the same, but with the last element.
plugins.tagline: Quickly select elements on the same level of hierarchy

48617.name: Select Siblings in Auto-Layout
48617.description:
A plugin that quickly selects elements inside auto-layout frames. It allows to pick just one element and then expand the selection in numerous ways. Can be useful when dealing with long lists of layers, such as news feeds, chat interfaces and many more.


Supports the commands listed below:


Select to the Beginning

Selects all the elements located before a selected one (i. e., those positioned above or to the left of the element in an auto-layout frame).


Select to the End

Similarly, expands a selection so as it will include the elements located after a selected one (positioned below or to the right of the element).


Select Between Elements

Selects all elements located between the two nodes that have been already selected.


Expand a Selection Backward

Adds the previous element to a selection.


Expand a Selection Forward

Similarly, adds the next one.


Select the First

Basically, selects the first element in a list.


Select the Last

Does the same, but with the last element.
48617.release_notes: Add the Select Between Elements command
48617.tagline: Quickly select elements on the same level of hierarchy

plugins.name: Page Status
plugins.description:
Getting Started:

  • The plugin will automatically display the current page you are on
  • Select an emoji from the dropdown.
  • Change the page status
  • Simply select another page and repeat the process
  • Select the first item in the dropdown to remove the status


Changing status will add the selected emoji plus a pipe symbol "|" as a prefix to your page name. You can still edit your page names as you normally would.


Note: this plugin uses the pipe symbol as a delimiter. Changing the name may affect the plugins ability to recognise the current status.


The plugin remains open as you flip between your pages to change statuses. Close it whenever you want.


Settings

The plugin supports up to 8 custom emojis and corresponding statuses. Click on Settings to review the panel and update any of the fields as you wish.


Free

This plugin is free!
plugins.tagline: Quickly indicate to your team the status of the pages you are working on

plugins.name: OctaCopy
plugins.description:
Never worry about copy of your design files anymore. Now you can generate world-class copy of the website/app you are designing in seconds.


With our prompt template, we ask minimum input from your side for optimal output.


Either generate copy as if website/app users generated it (comments, client testimonials, etc.) or as if a professional copywriter did it (error pages, descriptions, titles, etc.).


You can use our prompt template, or use custom prompts for more custom results.


Made with 🧡 by Calda!
plugins.tagline: Auto generate world-class copy in seconds with ChatGPT.

plugins.name: Site Mapper
plugins.description:
Site Mapper helps you to quickly export your website frames into a fully functional sitemap automatically linked to your project frames.

The sitemap is easily customisable through Figma styles, and for even more flexibility the extension also offers various filters, including:

  1. 💠 Layer types (frame, components…)
  2. ✏️ Layer names (include, exclude query)
  3. 👁 Layer states (visible or hidden)
plugins.tagline: Fast sitemap prototype creation

plugins.name: CSV to Sticky
plugins.description:
Easily convert your CSV file to FigJam sticky notes. Perfect for brainstorming, planning, or making your data more interactive and collaborative.


How to use:

Prepare your CSV file with rows of data.

Each cell will become its own sticky note.

Example CSV format:


Column 1, Column 2, Column 3

Data 1, Data 2, Data 3

Data 4, Data 5, Data 6

Data 7, Data 8, Data 9

accepted.name: Niyas V
accepted.description: Community Advocate -  Friends of Figma, Kochi

plugins.tagline: Effortlessly Convert CSV Data into Beautiful Sticky Notes in FigJam

plugins.name: GlowStick
plugins.description:
Make any design stand out more with uniquely generated glow effects.

Simply click on any element and apply the effects with a button.


  1. Background glow, one clicks effects for any Frame elements, almost unlimited combinations.
  2. Glow Pattern: Highlight elements with distinct and Unique glowing gradients.
  3. Rainbow Glow: Apply rainbow RGB lighting to any element with one click.


Video Tutorial & Example usage for the Plugin (Click Here).


---------------------------------------------------------------------GlowStick+

Simply purchase the license on Gumorad and Activate license within plugin.

  1. One-time purchase: $9.90
  2. Unlimited Background Glow
  3. Unlimited Apply Glow Pattern
  4. Unlimited Rainbow Glow


--------------------------------------------------------------------

Support

For any suggestions or support inquires email, support contact displayed on the right hand side.

plugins.name: Measure UX
plugins.description:
Measure UX is an advanced Figma plugin that leverages Artificial Intelligence to automatically evaluate designs based on Nielsen’s 10 Usability Heuristics. Detect usability issues, receive actionable recommendations, and enhance user experience efficiently. Perfect for designers, UX researchers, and developers looking to optimize their projects with data-driven insights.


Key Features:


Automated analysis based on Nielsen’s heuristics.

Detailed feedback with specific insights and recommendations.

Firebase integration for usage tracking and queue management.

Intuitive interface with organized results directly within Figma.

Prioritization of critical issues for faster decision-making.
plugins.tagline: AI-Powered Usability Evaluation for Figma

118536.name: Measure UX
118536.description:
Measure UX is an advanced Figma plugin that leverages Artificial Intelligence to automatically evaluate designs based on Nielsen’s 10 Usability Heuristics. Detect usability issues, receive actionable recommendations, and enhance user experience efficiently. Perfect for designers, UX researchers, and developers looking to optimize their projects with data-driven insights.


Key Features:


Automated analysis based on Nielsen’s heuristics.

Detailed feedback with specific insights and recommendations.

Firebase integration for usage tracking and queue management.

Intuitive interface with organized results directly within Figma.

Prioritization of critical issues for faster decision-making.

networkAccess.reasoning: Required for AI analysis of UI designs using Google's Generative AI API

118536.release_notes: 🔧 We've just released a minor update focusing on stability improvements. This update addresses backend changes in our tracking system and fixes issues with button interaction analytics. We've also updated our API integration to ensure smoother performance and more reliable data collection. These changes won't affect your workflow but will help us better understand how the plugin is being used to continue improving your experience. As always, we appreciate your support and feedback.

plugins.name: Freeflow
plugins.description:
Freeflow simplifies designing user flows, diagrams, and graphics


Key Features

  1. Auto-Adjust: Connectors update dynamically as you move elements
  2. Perfectly spaced start and end points for clean designs
  3. Keep Freeflow open while you continue working seamlessly
  4. Corner Radius: Adjust the smoothness of curves
  5. Stroke Width: Customize connector thickness
  6. Color Picker: Easily change connector colors to match your design theme
  7. Hide Selectors: Turn off connector dots for a clutter-free canvas
  8. Draw on selection : Disable the selection while creating the connector
  9. Quickly refresh all connectors using the Update All Connectors

accepted.name: Birdeye
accepted.description: The leading platform for reputation, social media, and customer experience. Trusted by 150k + businesses to manage reputation and grow sales.

plugins.tagline: Creating user flows made simple with freeflow!

plugins.name: Cookie Status
plugins.description:
Cookie Status is a simple plugin used to indicate the status of a screen of a project.


How to use?

Select a frame > Navigate to the "Plugins" menu > Select "Cookie Status" and them > Select the status of your frame.


Tips

- You can select multiple frames at once. Each frame will get its own status badge.


Based on Frame Status by Héctor Vásquez, see it on [GitHub](https://github.com/hecvasro/status-for-figma).

13938.name: Cookie Status
13938.description:

Based on Frame Status by Héctor Vásquez, see it on [GitHub](https://github.com/hecvasro/status-for-figma).

plugins.name: Instance Swapper
plugins.description:
Elevate your Figma workflow:

  • Exchange components between any two selected instances.
  • Works with both nested and standalone instances.
  • Speed up component replacements and design tweaks.


This plugin is UI-free for a streamlined experience. While no default shortcut is set, users can configure one through their OS settings if preferred.

accepted.name: Yaroslav Lozhkin
accepted.description: 👋 Hey, I'm an evil martian product designer

plugins.tagline: Swap components of two Figma instances, nested or free, with ease
